choices.D: Deploy two identically sized SAP S/4HANA systems, each in a different Availability Zone in the primary AWS Region. Set up synchronous SAP HANA system replication with preload between the systems. For DR, set up S3 Cross-Region Replication (CRR) for SAP HANA backup files from the primary Region to the secondary Region.
choices.B: Deploy two identically sized SAP S/4HANA systems, each in a different Availability Zone in the primary AWS Region. Set up synchronous SAP HANA system replication with preload between the systems. Set up a full-size DR system with asynchronous SAP HANA system replication without preload to the secondary Region.
choices.A: Deploy two identically sized SAP S/4HANA systems, each in a different Availability Zone in the primary AWS Region. Set up synchronous SAP HANA system replication with preload between the systems. Set up a pilot light DR system with asynchronous SAP HANA system replication without preload to the secondary Region.
choices.C: Deploy two SAP S/4HANA systems, each in a different Availability Zone in the primary AWS Region. Use a smaller size for the secondary system. Set up synchronous SAP HANA system replication without preload between the systems. Set up a pilot light DR system with asynchronous SAP HANA system replication to the secondary Region.

questions.question_text:
A company wants to implement a highly available SAP S/4HANA workload on AWS with automatic failover. The company also needs a cross-Region disaster recovery (DR) solution for the SAP S/4HANA production system. The company has a required RPO of up to 15 minutes and a required RTO of up to 120 minutes for the DR solution.

Which solution will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Pilot light meets both RPO and RTO requirements most cost effectively. So answer is A. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/reliability-pillar/rel_planning_for_recovery_disaster_recovery.html

Selected Answer: A
Should be A.

Should be A.

B provides similar solution but more expensive that A.
C the secondary standby in the primary region probably cannot handle the load due to the smaller instance size.
D it is going to take ages to restore those backup, that is provided that the backup is taken and replicated as per the RPO. In short D is completely insane.

Selected Answer: D
S3 Cross Region Replication is the most cost effective https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/general/scenarios.html#different-regions
A. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/hana-ops-patterns-multi.html

Selected Answer: C
C would be the best regarding the costs, just switch the instance type to bigger before taking over.

comments.content: C does not support "implement a highly available SAP S/4HANA workload on AWS with automatic failover"

questions.question_text:
A company is planning to migrate its SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) 7.5 system on SAP HANA from on premises to AWS. The production database is 4 TB in size and has a scale-out architecture that consists of three nodes. Each node has 2 TB of memory. The company needs to keep the three SAP HANA nodes in the target architecture.

Which solution on AWS will provide the HIGHEST throughput for the SAP HANA database?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Should be B.

As per https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/placement-groups.html , instances in the same cluster placement group enjoy a higher per-flow throughput limit for TCP/IP traffic and are placed in the same high-bisection bandwidth segment of the network.

A: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/ena-express-sap-hana.html. Given this is a recent "Amazon EC2 instances now support ENA Express, allowing a single flow bandwidth of up to 25 Gbps between instances, without requiring a cluster placement group." makes the most sense.

choices.B: Implement SAP HANA scale-out Amazon EC2 instances with Capacity Reservations in a cluster placement group.
choices.C: Implement SAP HANA scale-out Amazon EC2 instances in a spread placement group.
choices.D: Implement SAP HANA scale-out Amazon EC2 instances in a partition placement group.
choices.A: Implement SAP HANA scale-out Amazon EC2 instances with default tenancy.

questions.question_text:
A company is running its on-premises SAP ERP Central Component (SAP ECC) workload on SAP HANA. The company wants to perform SAP S/4HANA conversion of the on-premises SAP ECC on SAP HANA landscape and migrate to AWS.

Which solutions can the company use to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
DMS is not mentioned in the documentation:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/migrating-hana-tools.html

comments.content:
Nor is it in the following. I bet on your answer.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/migrating-hana-hana-to-aws.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Should be B and C, migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S4/Hana requires SAP S/4HANA conversion.

choices.C: Perform migration of the SAP ECC on SAP HANA system to AWS by using SAP HANA system replication for database migration and AWS Application Migration Service for migration of the SAP ECC application instances. Perform SAP S/4HANA conversion by using SAP Software Update Manager (SUM).
choices.E: Perform SAP S/4HANA conversion of the SAP ECC on SAP HANA system by using SAP Software Update Manager (SUM). Migrate the database to AWS by using AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS). Deploy SAP S/4HANA application instances.
choices.B: Perform SAP S/4HANA conversion and migration of the SAP ECC on SAP HANA system to AWS by using SAP Software Update Manager (SUM) Database Migration Option (DMO) with System Move.
choices.D: Perform SAP S/4HANA conversion of the SAP ECC on SAP HANA system by using SAP Software Provisioning Manager. Migrate to AWS by using AWS Application Migration Service.
choices.A: Perform SAP S/4HANA conversion of the SAP ECC on SAP HANA system by using SAP Software Update Manager (SUM). Migrate to AWS by using SAP Software Provisioning Manager.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
A subnet cannot span across availability zones.
Security group for inbound connections on database should be allowed.

comments.content: whoops ACD B (not C) outbound is open by default and should be working from the start

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
ABD
C - outbound is open by default and should be working from the start
E - not an issue as DB can communicate
F - not relevant to the problem

choices.A: Turn off the source/destination check on each bare metal instance.
choices.B: Modify the security groups to ensure that the minimal ports for connectivity between the application server and the database are opened.
choices.D: Ensure that both bare metal instances are in the same subnet.
choices.C: Add a route table entry to the route tables for the subnets of both bare metal instances for the overlay IP address.
choices.F: Move the Pacemaker cluster to EC2 VM instances instead of bare metal instances.
choices.E: Perform a failover and tailback by using the Pacemaker cluster. Check whether the overlay IP address routing is functioning correctly.

questions.question_text:
A company is deploying SAP Business Suite on SAP HANA by using two Amazon EC2 bare metal instances. The company has set up a Pacemaker cluster for SAP HANA. The cluster is set up between the two instances, which are configured to use SAP HANA system replication.

An SAP engineer notices that the overlay IP address is not reachable from the application servers. The overlay IP address is only reachable locally on the database cluster. Which actions should the SAP engineer take to resolve this issue? (Choose three.)

choices.C: For the ASCS instance, configure an overlay IP address that is within the production VPC CIDR range. Create a target group that points to the overlay IP address. Create a Network Load Balancer, and register the target group. Create a static route on the production VPC to route traffic that is directed to the overlay IP address to the ASCS instance.
choices.D: For the ASCS instance, configure an overlay IP address that is outside the production VPC CIDR range. Create a target group that points to the overlay IP address. Create a Network Load Balancer, and register the target group. Create a static route on the production VPC to route traffic that is directed to the overlay IP address to the ASCS instance.
choices.A: For the ASCS instance, configure an overlay IP address that is within the production VPC CIDR range. Create an AWS Transit Gateway. Attach the VPN to the transit gateway. Use the transit gateway to route the communications between the local data center and the production VPC. Create a static route on the production VPC to route traffic that is directed to the overlay IP address to the ASCS instance.
choices.B: For the ASCS instance, configure an overlay IP address that is outside the production VPC CIDR range. Create an AWS Transit Gateway. Attach the VPN to the transit gateway. Use the transit gateway to route the communications between the local data center and the production VPC. Create a static route on the production VPC to route traffic that is directed to the overlay IP address to the ASCS instance.
choices.E: For the ASCS instance, configure an overlay IP address that is outside the production VPC CIDR range. Create a target group that points to the overlay IP address. Create an Application Load Balancer, and register the target group. Create a static route on the production VPC to route traffic that is directed to the overlay IP address to the ASCS instance.

discussion.content:
Answer：BD
SAP on AWS High Availability with Overlay IP Address Routing：
AWS Transit Gateway serves as central hub to facilitate network connection to an overlay IP address.
Elastic Load Balancing where a Network Load Balancer enables network access to an overlay IP addres
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/sap-ha-overlay-ip.html
Application load balancer cannot be attached with Overlay IP

Selected Answer: BD
Overlay IP should be outside Prod VPC CIDR, thus A and C are eliminated. 
HA of ASCS uses Network load balancer and not application load balancer, so E is eliminated

Selected Answer: AC
voting A,C

Answers.
B-D

a-c 
should be within the prod VPC CIDR range.

comments.content: the Application Load Balancer is not a good choice for this application because it is designed for HTTP traffic, not SAP traffic

discussion.content: Why application load balancer and not network load balancer ?
I think BD

Selected Answer: BD
B and D

Selected Answer: BD
I think B,D

Selected Answer: BD
I think B/D

questions.question_text:
A company wants to migrate its SAP ERP landscape to AWS. The company will use a highly available distributed deployment for the new architecture. Clients will access SAP systems from a local data center through an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection that is already in place. An SAP solutions architect needs to design the network access to the SAP production environment.
Which configuration approaches will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

exam.name: AWS Certified SAP on AWS - Specialty PAS-C01
